title: I got banned for this ?
body:
So, I was playing duoq with my girlfriend. When these 2 premades start flaming me since the start of the game. They calling me stupid for playing adc with cull, calling me retard and other things because I was missing my skillshots or choosing to recall instead of farming. I asked the enemy team to report them and they kept going so I started to afk farm because they were too toxic. And at the end of the game they told me I will get banned. I've been banned before and now I got perma banned for this ? I didn't call them retards or anything close to that because I decided to stop flaming.. How is this fair ? RIOT didn't even check the chat logs..
IGN : GodOfLoLDarcky (funny, I know).
Server : EUNE.
I can even provide the last chat logs so you guys can have a look..

replies.body:
You were not banned for a single game, like you are stating.

Multiple games of chat logs were given in your reform card. In EVERY single one of them, you said 'open [insert lane here]' and gave up. You were essentially giving away a free win to the enemy team because you were tilted.

This also is not your first penalty.  This is your 4th penalty, and you just got off a 14-day ban less than a week ago for the SAME behavior.

> I can even provide the last chat logs so you guys can have a look..

It's very difficult to have a conversation about being rightfully banned without logs. If you'd like, I can post them all for you here.

Please do !
How is it fair to play when my team is either trolling or flaming ?
Btw, can you also post the chat logs of wukong and shen from my last game ? so they can see what I've had to deal with ?
If you won't, I will, so the people on the forums can have a look at what kind of flame I received the whole game.
I chose to let the enemy team win because flamers like them don't deserve to win. Even after doing a nice clean up around enemy red buff they called me stupid and retarded for recalling instead of farming bot. Is that fair ?

Game 1:
[0:49] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): Tipic.
[1:15] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): Taci si joaca cu ignite pe top.
[1:24] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): Vezi ca ai mancat un i mai shen.
[1:36] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): Romani..
[1:39] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): #muted.
[6:15] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): Nice farm wukonmg,\
[8:48] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): Report zed, ty.
[9:28] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): He wanted to pick yasuo, imagine that.
[10:16] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): ...
[11:18] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): Yes please.
[11:23] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): Open mid, end the game.
[11:52] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): And report wukong for excessive flame, cheers.
[12:42] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): This game doesn't work usuallyt, not a huge surprise.
[14:25] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): As I said, please report wukong for flame. :)
[14:43] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): I'm ignoring him, ask zed.
[16:03] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): Gotta appreciate that tower range.
[19:26] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): And wukong keeps flaming. <3
[19:37] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): I didn't want the kill..
[19:44] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): I just wanted you off the map..
[19:49] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): I even told naut.
[23:48] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): I am afk.
[23:55] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): Thank wukong and shen for flame. :)
[24:18] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): They're premades btw. :)
[24:37] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): I will just afk farm. End mid.
[25:40] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): Kata..
[25:43] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): I swear to God man..
[25:47] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): They've flamed me..
[25:53] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): Since the game started..
[26:00] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): And they expect me to play.
[26:10] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): I'd rather loose than let this kind of people win..
[26:15] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): I don't care zed.
[26:26] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): Nope.
[26:58] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): Mai tarziu. :)
[27:07] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): Putin imi pasa.
[27:16] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): E relax in s2, chill.
[27:26] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): Vom vedea cine ia bann. :)
[29:06] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): And you are flaming. What a lovely world ! <3
[29:16] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): :)
[29:32] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): I will. :)
[29:55] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): Will do.
[30:54] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Jinx): Sick of flamers.

Game 2:

[9:16] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Vel'Koz): My team is trash.

[15:52] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Vel'Koz): I am decent.
[15:54] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Vel'Koz): Not perfect.

[26:06] GodOfLoLDarcky (Vel'Koz): I 1 v 1'd him.
[26:11] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Vel'Koz): Ez.

Game 3:

[30:31] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Caitlyn): Open, end.
[30:48] GodOfLoLDarcky (Caitlyn): Play def because you can't ?
[30:58] GodOfLoLDarcky (Caitlyn): Learn to play def if you want others to def.

[31:34] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Caitlyn): They chose to run for kha zix..
[32:22] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Caitlyn): gg ez.

[30:16] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Viktor): And you need to learn to help your team and gank graves, gc.
[30:43] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Viktor): Jinx, go to the practice tool.
[30:52] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Viktor): And add some bots.
[30:55] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Viktor): And learn to farm first.
[31:03] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Viktor): Farm is the main thing in this game.
[31:09] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Viktor): It gives you gold for items.
[31:41] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Viktor): Then learn to trade in lane.
[32:07] [All] GodOfLoLDarcky (Viktor): Trading means attacking your ene

##PRACTICE TOOL ENCOURAGES TOXICITY, LYTE WAS RIGHT ALL ALONG

Jokes aside, wow. This guy needs to learn how to chill, those logs are terrible. Thanks for posting Tantram.

> [{quoted}](name=GodOfLoLDarcky,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=VyddWbEB,comment-id=0009000100010000,timestamp=2017-04-17T18:18:22.904+0000)

Riot ban system is biased because it doesn't take into account the context of the situation. That's fine though, if you disagree with it move to a different game.

Players who refer to "context" on the board to decry a punishment as unfair usually mean "the other person was toxic to me first!" When the other person is toxic first, it doesn't give you a green light to be toxic in return. When someone else is breaking the rules, you are expected to refrain from following their example and making a bad situation worse.

The "But he started it!" defence doesn't hold up anywhere except maybe kindergarten.

The only context necessary is that you are in a game with nine other players, and you are actively contributing to a negative game experience for up to nine of them.

Just because one or more of them are ruining your gameplay doesn't excuse you escalating the situation and further destroying any semblance of a fun game for everyone.

Do you know the chance of two toxic players meeting in a game? It's 1/100 with the statistics I provided. (10% x 10% = 1%). If one in 100 games have two toxic members who will flame eachother, what's the chance you'll get caught in the middle of it and  have to face an emotional punishment for at least 20 minutes. Most people will break when getting flamed by two or more people, good for you that you can use the mute button. Good for you that you don't care what others think but most people can't deal with it. At least with the personal stuff, most players can deal with being called bad at a game but when you start getting personal it usually hurts enough to provoke. I'm not saying this is the case with this person, not even trying to argue that. But acknowledge it does happen and people are being punished for human reaction.

> [{quoted}](name=Pouting,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=VyddWbEB,comment-id=00090001000100010000000000000000,timestamp=2017-04-17T18:37:17.494+0000)> Do you know the chance of two toxic players meeting in a game? It's 1/100 with the statistics I provided. [10% x 10% = 1%].

Well, the statistic Riot has given us is 5% of players being punished, but let's assume your statistics are correct for the sake of an argument.

>If one in 100 games have two toxic members who will flame eachother, what's the chance you'll get caught in the middle of it and  have to face an emotional punishment for at least 20 minutes. 

Here's the problem though. Let's assume that you're someone who responds to a toxic environment with added toxicity. Then let's compare that to a non-toxic player caught in the middle.

The non-toxic player encounters a game with two toxic players arguing 1% of the time, by your statistics. If they don't engage or respond in a toxic manner, this means 1% of their games will have two toxic players arguing.

The toxic player responds to toxicity WITH toxicity. 10% of players are toxic, and, when he encounters one, he reacts in a similar fashion. That player will thus behave toxically  10% of the time -- each time he encounters another toxic player. He's part of the problem, as he turns 10% of his games into what SHOULD be 1% of his games.

>Most people will break when getting flamed by two or more people

Source? This seems contrary to my many-year *League* experience, but anecdotal evidence on both our sides isn't helpful. If Riot is correct and 5% of players are punished for toxicity, that seems to go against the "most people will break" statement.

Either way, there is hitting a point where you snap, and RELIABLY hitting a point where you snap, or snapping in such a way that you insult, belittle, or flame your fellow players. Getting angry or frustrated isn't a problem: creating a negative environment with HOW you show your anger and frustration is.

Your math is a little off.  If 10% of the player base was toxic, then in any given game the expectation would be that there would be one toxic person. The odds of two **particular** players being toxic would be about 1%, but the odds of **any** two players being toxic would be much higher than that. The exact number I'm not sure; it's been a while since my last course in statistics.

That experience (at least 1 toxic person in every game) is not typical. I am not saying the community is perfect, it's far from it, but I would say that I see someone with a negative attitude every few games (which usually only turns nasty if two people start bickering or whatever), and a truly toxic person is much more rare than that.

If you are experiencing that extremely high frequency of toxic players, I think that perhaps you should step back for a moment and think about what your own contributions to those negative situations are. After all, you are the common factor in your games. Are you good about defusing possibly toxic situations before they explode into a flame war, or at least muting people and not contributing to the negativity? Or do you sometimes make things worse by being drawn into the toxicity?

Eh, just don't admit to it in chat if you're going to give up. Either that or just keep playing and report them after, OR you can even ask the enemy team what they think. Often, when I have a 1/12 player flaming me for being bad when I believe I'm doing alright, I ask the enemy team what they think. They usually say that I'm doing fine, and that makes me feel better. Sometimes I do actually perform poorly, and just apologize for a bad game.
I know none of my business, but I love this response. Just missing the Mic drop.

Asking for reports in chat is against the rules. They really need to make a giant dialog box every time you queue that says that.

If someone is rude to you, report them and be quiet about it. Dragging other people into the situation doesn't do any good for anyone.

Its not unless you use it for harrasment. If you write "wow, report yi no ganks" you could argue thats a jumping off point for harrassment. If Yi is spewing out homophobic slurs, you writing "Wow guys, please report yi, that is really offensive" wont get you punished, but multible reports from the same game also dont stack so calling for reports is kind of useless.

My understanding is that any asking for reports is against the rules, since report stacking makes literally 0 difference the only reason you're doing it is to get sympathy or drag other people into the toxicity, i.e. you are making the situation worse i.e. don't do it.

> [{quoted}](name=Verxint,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=VyddWbEB,comment-id=000500000000,timestamp=2017-04-17T18:19:36.462+0000)
>
> My understanding is that any asking for reports is against the rules, since report stacking makes literally 0 difference the only reason you're doing it is to get sympathy or drag other people into the toxicity, i.e. you are making the situation worse i.e. don't do it.

This should be something you get warned for separate from being toxic because this is a different problem. This is not "toxic", asking for sympathy is not toxic unless you ask in a toxic manner. It should be bannable, but separate from racism, homophobic slurs, and flaming.

Asking for sympathy is toxic though. You have two choices - be quiet or engage other people. One of these is likely to result in more needless chat messages as the other person jumps to all chat to defend themselves, and now 10 people are having their game ruined instead of 5. You have nothing to gain from asking for reports except self-aggrandizement, and if you're more concerned with vindication than with playing the game, you are being toxic.

I will agree Riot needs to clarify some of the rules and philosophy behind their decisions
